streams package¶

streams.create_domain_matrices module¶

streams.create_domain_matrices.get_air_quality(force_download: bool = False) → Tuple[torch.utils.data.dataset.Dataset, List[numpy.ndarray], numpy.ndarray, numpy.ndarray][source]¶

Retrieves and preprocesses the Beijing Air Quality dataset. Domain is the station the measurement was taken from.

Parameters

force_download (bool, optional) – Defaults to False.

Returns

typing.Tuple[ torch.utils.data.Dataset, typing.List[np.ndarray],

np.ndarray, np.ndarray ]: Dataset, domain matrices of size (num_examples, num_domain_vals) for each domain, time periods (if time is a domain), and time ordering

streams.create_domain_matrices.get_iwildcam(force_download: bool = False, num_location_groups: int = 10) → Tuple[torch.utils.data.dataset.Dataset, List[numpy.ndarray], numpy.ndarray, numpy.ndarray][source]¶

Retrieve and break down the IWildCam dataset along the time and location (camera ID) domain types.

Parameters

num_location_groups – how many values there should be for the “location” domain type (e.g., if 10, then allocate the 300+ camera IDs into 10 groups)

Returns

utils.FullDataset domain_matrices: list of np.ndarray time_periods: np.ndarray (or None, if time is not a domain) time_ordering: np.ndarray representing time-based ordering

Return type

dataset

streams.utils.adult_filter(data: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame[source]¶

Mimic the filters in place for Adult data. Adult documentation notes: Extraction was done by Barry Becker from the 1994 Census database. A set of reasonably clean records was extracted using the following conditions: ((AAGE>16) && (AGI>100) && (AFNLWGT>1)&& (HRSWK>0))

streams.utils.aggregate_min(arrays: List[numpy.ndarray], use_cvx: bool = True) → numpy.ndarray[source]¶

Takes the minimum across all arrays.

Parameters

  • arrays (List[np.ndarray]) – List of np arrays.

  • use_cvx (bool, optional) – Whether to use cvx. Defaults to True.

Returns

Min np array.

Return type

np.ndarray

streams.utils.apply_ops(doc: str, mask: str, ops: list, source: str) → Tuple[str, str][source]¶

Applies quilljs operations on a string. Taken from the CoAuthor website.

Parameters

  • doc (str) – Text so far (input document).

  • mask (str) – Character mask describing inputs.

  • ops (list) – List of JSON from quilljs.

  • source (str) – API or user.

Returns

Final string and mask after ops.

Return type

Tuple[str, str]

streams.utils.create_logits(domain_matrices: List[numpy.ndarray], T: int, gamma: float = 0.5, num_peaks: int = 5, start_max: int = 10, duration: int = 1, log_step: int = 10, starting_time_steps: Dict[Tuple[int, int], int] = {}, seed: int = 0) → Tuple[List[numpy.ndarray], List[numpy.ndarray]][source]¶

Creates logits and signals for T steps based on domain matrices.

Parameters

  • domain_matrices (List[np.ndarray]) – List of domain matrices.

  • T (int) – _description_

  • gamma (float, optional) – Defaults to 0.5.

  • num_peaks (int, optional) – Defaults to 5.

  • start_max (int, optional) – Defaults to 10.

  • starting_time_steps – A map of domain values to the timestep at which their signal value can be non-zero. For sufficiently large start_max, this precludes the chance of examples appearing early.

  • seed (int, optional) – Defaults to 0.

Returns

List of logits vectors, list of signals

Return type

Tuple[List[np.ndarray], List[np.ndarray]]

streams.utils.get_completion(text: str, mask: str) → str[source]¶

Removes prompt from text.

Parameters

  • text (str) – Text generated so far.

  • mask (str) – Mask describing prompt or completion.

Returns

text without prompt.

Return type

str

streams.utils.get_prompts_and_completions(events: list, session_id: str, drop_keyword: str = 'DROP_KEYWORD') → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame[source]¶

For a session, returns a dataframe of prompts and completions. Every row in the dataframe represents a snapshot of the session taken every stride steps.

Parameters

  • events (list) – List of quilljs events for a session.

  • session_id (str) – Session ID.

  • drop_keyword (str, optional) – Keyword that represents drop. Defaults to “DROP_KEYWORD”.

Returns

Prompts and completions for a session.

Return type

pd.DataFrame
